DataElement.preferredName: PET Mediastinum Uptake Score Deauville Criteria Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric representation for the mediastinum uptake using the PET Deauville scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Positron Emission Tomography Mediastinum Uptake London Deauville Criteria Point Scale Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered._A group of organs surrounded by loose connective tissue, separating the two pleural sacs, between the sternum anteriorly and the vertebral column posteriorly as well as from the thoracic inlet superiorly to the diaphragm inferiorly. The mediastinum contains the heart and pericardium, the bases of the great vessels, the trachea and bronchi, esophagus, thymus, lymph nodes, thoracic duct, phrenic and vagus nerves, and other structures and tissues._The absorption by a tissue of some substance, food material, mineral, etc., and its permanent or temporary retention._A 5 point scale devised to assess the response to treatment of Hodgkins and Aggressive Non-Hodgkins Lymphoma._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A noninvasive imaging method that provides information about cellular activity (metabolic information).  It is used along with magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) which provides information about the shape and size of the tumor (spatial information).

Concepts.definition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.

Property.preferredName: Mediastinum Uptake London Deauville Criteria Point Scale Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A group of organs surrounded by loose connective tissue, separating the two pleural sacs, between the sternum anteriorly and the vertebral column posteriorly as well as from the thoracic inlet superiorly to the diaphragm inferiorly. The mediastinum contains the heart and pericardium, the bases of the great vessels, the trachea and bronchi, esophagus, thymus, lymph nodes, thoracic duct, phrenic and vagus nerves, and other structures and tissues.:The absorption by a tissue of some substance, food material, mineral, etc., and its permanent or temporary retention.:A 5 point scale devised to assess the response to treatment of Hodgkins and Aggressive Non-Hodgkins Lymphoma.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: An anatomic site along the midline and under the sternum that contains the heart and pericardium, the bases of the great vessels, the trachea and bronchi, esophagus, thymus, lymph nodes, thoracic duct, phrenic and vagus nerves, and other structures and tissues.
The absorption by a tissue of some substance, food material, mineral, etc., and its permanent or temporary retention.
A 5 point scale devised to assess the response to treatment of Hodgkin and Aggressive Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for LCC study in C3D as requested by K. Krishnamurthy. mc 12/7/16

ValueDomain.preferredName: PET Deauville Criteria Score 5 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: London Deauville Criteria Point Scale X

ValueMeaning.preferredName: London Deauville Criteria Point Scale X
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: New areas of uptake unlikely to be related to lymphoma.

Concepts.longName: London Deauville Criteria Point Scale X
Concepts.definition: New areas of uptake unlikely to be related to lymphoma.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The results of the positron emission tomography are negative; there is no detectable abnormal tracer uptake.

Concepts.definition: The results of the positron emission tomography are negative; there is no detectable abnormal tracer uptake.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The results of the positron emission tomography are negative; the tracer uptake is less than or equal to the mediastinum.

Concepts.definition: The results of the positron emission tomography are negative; the tracer uptake is less than or equal to the mediastinum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The results of the positron emission tomography are negative; the tracer uptake is greater than the mediastinum but less than or equal to the liver.

Concepts.definition: The results of the positron emission tomography are negative; the tracer uptake is greater than the mediastinum but less than or equal to the liver.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The results of the positron emission tomography are positive; the tracer uptake is moderately more than the liver uptake, at any disease site.

Concepts.definition: The results of the positron emission tomography are positive; the tracer uptake is moderately more than the liver uptake, at any disease site.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The results of the positron emission tomography are positive; the tracer uptake is markedly increased at any disease site.

Concepts.definition: The results of the positron emission tomography are positive; the tracer uptake is markedly increased at any disease site.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
